alert.note: Alert for Burt; Cedar; Cuming; Dodge; Thurston; Wayne (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 12 at 2:43AM CST until January 12 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until midnight CST tonight. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST today. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 9 PM this evening to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be nearly impossible at times. Areas of blowing snow will result in periods of near blizzard conditions, even after snow has stopped falling. The hazardous conditions will impact the Friday commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Burt; Cedar; Cuming; Dodge; Thurston; Wayne
